definition: Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
abbr. for Hunan 湖南 province in south central China/abbr. for Xiangjiang river in Hunan province

sentences.english: But there isn't such a brand in Hunan, either a brand project on it.
sentences.chinese: “电视湘军”最多只算得上是一个非典型性品牌工程。

sentences.english: Zeng Guoquan was the younger brother of Zeng Guofan who was very famous general of the Xiang Army.
sentences.chinese: 曾国荃是曾国藩的胞弟，著名湘军将领。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important for the research of the Taiping Heavenly Kindom to research waterborne forces of Hunan Army.
sentences.chinese: 考察湘军水师于是成为研究太平天国史的重要课题。

sentences.english: The fast rising Xiang Army of Comparative Literature becomes the focus of the national and international academic field.
sentences.chinese: 迅速崛起的比较文学湘军已引起国内外学界的瞩目。

sentences.english: The expansion of the modern Hunan gentry forces benefits considerably from the establishment of Zeng Guofans Xiang Army.
sentences.chinese: 近代湖南绅权势力的膨胀得益于曾国藩创办的湘军。

sentences.english: The third part is"Xiangjun Zhi"and Wang Kaiyun's historical thought.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分为《湘军志》与王闿运的史学思想。

sentences.english: Luo Zenan, a rationalistic Confucian philosopher of Xiang Troop, came from a poor family of Hunan countryside.
sentences.chinese: 湘军理学家罗泽南出生于湖南湘乡一个贫困的家庭里。

sentences.english: Neo-Confucianism and country-management is the main source of Hunan military group.
sentences.chinese: 理学和经世之学是湘军集团两个重要的文化来源。

definition: Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
Nian Army, leading a peasant rebellion against the Qing dynasty in Shandong, Henan, Jiangsu and Anhui 1851-1868, at the same time as the Taiping Rebellion further south
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
local militia formed to suppress peasant rebellion (old)
Green standard army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
the Qing court (as government of China)
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Hubei and Hunan provinces (a Ming dynasty province)
Hong Xiuquan or Hung Hsiu-ch'üan (1814-1864), leader of the Taiping rebellion or Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
Eight Banners, military organization of Manchu later Jin dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] from c. 1600, subsequently of the Qing dynasty
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
